Objective-C is a general-purpose object-: Swift is designed to work with Apple's Cocoa and Cocoa Touch frameworks and the large body of extant Objective-C (ObjC) code written for Apple products. It is built with the open source LLVM compiler framework and has been included in Xcode since version 6.

C# is a general-purpose object-oriented programming language. Its development team is led by Anders Hejlsberg. The most recent version is C# 7.0 which was released in 2017 along with Visual Studio 2017.
